titles.title: Permitting the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony to present the Congressional Gold Medal to Father Theodore Hesburgh.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Mr. Thomas moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 344.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 6/27/2000--Passed House amended. Authorizes the use of the Capitol rotunda on July 13, 2000, for a ceremony to present the Congressional Gold Medal to Father Theodore Hesburgh.
